[[Joel Savary]] |formercoach = [[Ron Ludington]] |choreographer = [[David Wilson (figure skater)|David Wilson]] |formerchoreographer = |skating club = [[Skating Club of New York| New York]] |beganskating = 2001 |retired = |combined total = 136.33 |combined date = [[2011â12 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2011 JGP Volvo Cup]] |SP score = 42.77 |SP date = [[2011â12 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2011 JGP Volvo Cup]] |FS score = 93.56 |FS date = [[2011â12 ISU Junior Grand Prix|2011 JGP Volvo Cup]] }} '''Emmanuel Savary''' (pronounced /i-MAN-yÉ-wÉl (English); born January 6, 1998) is an [[Americans|American]] mens [[figure skater]]. He is the 2009 intermediate mens U.S. champion and the 2010 U.S. novice mens silver medalist. Emmanuel won the 2009 Intermediate Mens National Championship at just 10 years old. He has his eyes set on the [[2014 Winter Olympics|2014 Winter Olympic Games]] in [[Sochi, Russia]] where he will be 16 years old. ==Career== Savary began skating at age 3 because he enjoyed watching his brother Joel skate. His biggest life-defining moment was winning the 2009 U.S. intermediate title. Savary made his [[ISU Junior Grand Prix]] debut in the season 2011-12. He competed at the [[2011â12 ISU Junior Grand Prix]] event in [[Latvia]] where he placed 14th. ==Programs== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Season ! Short program ! I = Intermediate level; N = Novice level; J = Junior level. ==Other Accomplishments== *Monica Malpass, [http://abclocal.go.com/wpvi/story?section=news/local&id=6583343 10-year-old figure skater is a Champ], abc.com, January 2009 *2010 AT&T U.S. Figure Skating Championships, Novice Men, 2nd [http://www.usfigureskating.org/leaderboard/results/2010/64740/results.html] *2010 Eastern Sectional, Novice Men, 2nd [http://www.usfigureskating.org/leaderboard/results/2010/65683/results.html] *2009 Passed [[USFSA]] Senior Moves In The Field test [http://www.udel.edu/udfsc/tests/results/2009April10.html], ''usfsa.org'',April 10, 2009 *2009 U.S. Junior Championships, Intermediate Men, 1st [http://web.icenetwork.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20081214&content_id=57726&vkey=ice_news] *2009 South Atlantic Regional, Intermediate Men, 1st [http://www.usfsa.org/content/events/200809/regionals-SA/2009%20SA%20Regional%20Complete%20Results.pdf] *2009 Liberty Open, Intermediate Men, 1st [http://www.libertyskating.org/2008ResultsMens.html] ==Reference== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.emmanuelsavary.net/ Official Website] *{{usfsa name | category=AthleteBio | id=44510 | name=Emmanuel Savary}} *{{isu name | id=00013331 | name=Emmanuel Savary}} {{Persondata | NAME =Savary, Emmanuel | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =January 6, 1998 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Miami, Florida]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Savary, Emmanuel}} [[Category:American male single skaters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1998 births]] {{us-figure-skating-bio-stub}}
